verses.text: The rod of correction imparts wisdom, but a child left to himself disgraces his mother.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 29:15
rsbNotes.text: 29:15 See 13:24; 22:15; 23:13, 14 and notes.

verses.text: When the wicked thrive, so does sin, but the righteous will see their downfall.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 29:16
rsbNotes.text: 29:16 This proverb implicitly expresses confidence in the ultimate establishment of a just order under the rule of God.

verses.text: Discipline your son, and he will give you peace; he will bring delight to your soul.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 29:17
rsbNotes.text: 29:17 Discipline. Not only chastening (v. 15) is in view, but also active and positive instruction in wisdom. In the covenantal context of Israelâ€™s faith, discipline and instruction come from the revelation of God in His word and acts.
